abstract: Cries of “Long live the United States! Long live Wilson!” and a standing ovation greeted the entrance of the American ambassador to watch a matinée at the Opéra-Comique.
lead_paragraph: PARIS —Yesterday afternoon’s matinée performance of “Madama Butterfly” at the Opéra-Comique, which was given by the Milan Scala company, under the direction of Signor Mocchi, was the occasion of a great manifestation of French friendship for and gratitude to America.
snippet: Cries of “Long live the United States! Long live Wilson!” and a standing ovation greeted the entrance of the American ambassador to watch a matinée at the Opéra-Comique....

headline.main: 1917: Audience Hails U.S. at ‘Madama Butterfly’ in Paris
